15#ifndef DNS_NCACHE_H
16#define DNS_NCACHE_H 1
17
18/*****
19 ***** Module Info
20 *****/
21
22/*! \file dns/ncache.h
23 *\brief
24 * DNS Ncache
25 *
26 * XXX TBS XXX
27 *
28 * MP:
29 *\li The caller must ensure any required synchronization.
30 *
31 * Reliability:
32 *\li No anticipated impact.
33 *
34 * Resources:
35 *\li TBS
36 *
37 * Security:
38 *\li No anticipated impact.
39 *
40 * Standards:
41 *\li RFC2308
42 */
43
44#include <stdbool.h>
45
46#include <isc/lang.h>
47#include <isc/stdtime.h>
48
49#include <dns/types.h>
50
51ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
52
53/*%
54 * _OMITDNSSEC:
55 * Omit DNSSEC records when rendering.
56 */
57#define DNS_NCACHETOWIRE_OMITDNSSEC 0x0001
58
59isc_result_t
60dns_ncache_add(dns_message_t *message, dns_db_t *cache, dns_dbnode_t *node,
61 dns_rdatatype_t covers, isc_stdtime_t now,
62 dns_ttl_t minttl, dns_ttl_t maxttl,
63 dns_rdataset_t *addedrdataset);
64isc_result_t
65dns_ncache_addoptout(dns_message_t *message, dns_db_t *cache,
66 dns_dbnode_t *node, dns_rdatatype_t covers,
67 isc_stdtime_t now,
68 dns_ttl_t minttl, dns_ttl_t maxttl,
69 bool optout, dns_rdataset_t *addedrdataset);
70/*%<
71 * Convert the authority data from 'message' into a negative cache
72 * rdataset, and store it in 'cache' at 'node' with a TTL limited to
73 * 'maxttl'.
74 *
75 * \li dns_ncache_add produces a negative cache entry with a trust of no
76 * more than answer
77 * \li dns_ncache_addoptout produces a negative cache entry which will have
78 * a trust of secure if all the records that make up the entry are secure.
79 *
80 * The 'covers' argument is the RR type whose nonexistence we are caching,
81 * or dns_rdatatype_any when caching a NXDOMAIN response.
82 *
83 * 'optout' indicates a DNS_RDATASETATTR_OPTOUT should be set.
84 *
85 * Note:
86 *\li If 'addedrdataset' is not NULL, then it will be attached to the added
87 * rdataset. See dns_db_addrdataset() for more details.
88 *
89 * Requires:
90 *\li 'message' is a valid message with a properly formatting negative cache
91 * authority section.
92 *
93 *\li The requirements of dns_db_addrdataset() apply to 'cache', 'node',
94 * 'now', and 'addedrdataset'.
95 *
96 * Returns:
97 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
98 *\li #ISC_R_NOSPACE
99 *
100 *\li Any result code of dns_db_addrdataset() is a possible result code
101 * of dns_ncache_add().
102 */
103
104isc_result_t
105dns_ncache_towire(dns_rdataset_t *rdataset, dns_compress_t *cctx,
106 isc_buffer_t *target, unsigned int options,
107 unsigned int *countp);
108/*%<
109 * Convert the negative caching rdataset 'rdataset' to wire format,
110 * compressing names as specified in 'cctx', and storing the result in
111 * 'target'. If 'omit_dnssec' is set, DNSSEC records will not
112 * be added to 'target'.
113 *
114 * Notes:
115 *\li The number of RRs added to target will be added to *countp.
116 *
117 * Requires:
118 *\li 'rdataset' is a valid negative caching rdataset.
119 *
120 *\li 'rdataset' is not empty.
121 *
122 *\li 'countp' is a valid pointer.
123 *
124 * Ensures:
125 *\li On a return of ISC_R_SUCCESS, 'target' contains a wire format
126 * for the data contained in 'rdataset'. Any error return leaves
127 * the buffer unchanged.
128 *
129 *\li *countp has been incremented by the number of RRs added to
130 * target.
131 *
132 * Returns:
133 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS - all ok
134 *\li #ISC_R_NOSPACE - 'target' doesn't have enough room
135 *
136 *\li Any error returned by dns_rdata_towire(), dns_rdataset_next(),
137 * dns_name_towire().
138 */
139
140isc_result_t
141dns_ncache_getrdataset(dns_rdataset_t *ncacherdataset, dns_name_t *name,
142 dns_rdatatype_t type, dns_rdataset_t *rdataset);
143/*%<
144 * Search the negative caching rdataset for an rdataset with the
145 * specified name and type.
146 *
147 * Requires:
148 *\li 'ncacherdataset' is a valid negative caching rdataset.
149 *
150 *\li 'ncacherdataset' is not empty.
151 *
152 *\li 'name' is a valid name.
153 *
154 *\li 'type' is not SIG, or a meta-RR type.
155 *
156 *\li 'rdataset' is a valid disassociated rdataset.
157 *
158 * Ensures:
159 *\li On a return of ISC_R_SUCCESS, 'rdataset' is bound to the found
160 * rdataset.
161 *
162 * Returns:
163 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS - the rdataset was found.
164 *\li #ISC_R_NOTFOUND - the rdataset was not found.
165 *
166 */
167
168isc_result_t
169dns_ncache_getsigrdataset(dns_rdataset_t *ncacherdataset, dns_name_t *name,
170 dns_rdatatype_t covers, dns_rdataset_t *rdataset);
171/*%<
172 * Similar to dns_ncache_getrdataset() but get the rrsig that matches.
173 */
174
175void
176dns_ncache_current(dns_rdataset_t *ncacherdataset, dns_name_t *found,
177 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset);
178
179/*%<
180 * Extract the current rdataset and name from a ncache entry.
181 *
182 * Requires:
183 * \li 'ncacherdataset' to be valid and to be a negative cache entry
184 * \li 'found' to be valid.
185 * \li 'rdataset' to be unassociated.
186 */
187
188ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
189
190#endif /* DNS_NCACHE_H */
191
